titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the "Hard Choices" Documentary Project Collection, 1982-1986 AIS.2004.19
titlestmt.author: Karen Dettloff.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:52:04 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: (120 films and 0.5 linear feet of notes and documentation)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is divided into two series: Audiovisual materials and Manuscript materials. The items in the collection are organized by date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains 117 videocassettes, including BetaSP, 3/4" Umatic, and VHS, and manuscript materials used to create the film "Hard Choices" by Daniel Kazimierski which documents the decline of the steel industry in Midland, Pennsylvania.

"Hard Choices" won two first-place film awards in 1987 for social commentary: the Dore Schary Award and another from the Association of Independent Video and Filmmakers. The film was also produced by Marion Lipshutz and Peggy Wiess. Ernest Borgnine provided the narration.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Steel production began in Midland, Pa., in 1906 by the Midland Steel Company which was purchased in 1911 by the Crucible Steel Company. Through expansions until the 1950s, Midland became a center of stainless steel manufacturing. The company was purchased by Colt Industries in 1968, sold again in the 1980s to LTV, and then sold to J&L Specialty Products Corporation.

Several generations of Midland residents were employed in steel manufacturing in Midland between 1906 and the 1980s. As with many steel towns in the region, the mill was where most people worked and wanted to work. With the stability of mill employment gone, businesses failed and many workers had trouble finding new jobs. Many workers suffered from what was called the "impossible dream syndrome." Some even believed that the plant closing was temporary, so no efforts towards job retraining were made.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Daniel Kazimierski served as both the producer and cinematographer for the film, "Hard Choices." He is an accomplished photographer with his work seen in galleries and in print throughout the United States and Europe. His films are also on deposit in the United States and Canada, including the National Film Board of Canada.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: This collection relates to other collection in the Archive Service Center, especially UE/Labor relating to deindustrialization. There is also a separate collection of Crucible Steel Safety Films.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by Daniel Kazimierski in 2004.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: "Hard Choices" Documentary Project Collection, 1982-1986, AIS.2004.19, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: "Hard Choices" Documentary Project Collection, 1982-1986, AIS.2004.19, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Playback of tapes requires use of various machines which are available in the Archives Service Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains 117 videocassettes, including BetaSP, 3/4" Umatic, and VHS tapes, that contain footage used to create the completed film, "Hard Choices."
